linear.name: Linear
linear.description: Constant speed from start to finish with no acceleration or deceleration
use_cases: Simple fades where natural motion isn't important

code.javascript: function linear(t) { return t; }
code.lua: function linear(t) return t end
code.gdscript:
func linear(t: float) -> float:
	return t
code.csharp: public static float Linear(float t) => t;
code.python:
def linear(t: float) -> float:
    return t

easeInQuad.name: Ease In Quadratic
easeInQuad.description: Starts slow and accelerates gradually with quadratic curve
use_cases: Object beginning to fall under gravity
UI elements starting to slide in

code.javascript: function easeInQuad(t) { return t * t; }
code.lua: function easeInQuad(t) return t * t end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_quad(t: float) -> float:
	return t * t
code.csharp: public static float EaseInQuad(float t) => t * t;
code.python:
def ease_in_quad(t: float) -> float:
    return t * t

easeOutQuad.name: Ease Out Quadratic
easeOutQuad.description: Starts fast and decelerates gradually to a gentle stop

code.javascript: function easeOutQuad(t) { return t * (2 - t); }
code.lua: function easeOutQuad(t) return t * (2 - t) end
code.gdscript:
func ease_out_quad(t: float) -> float:
	return t * (2.0 - t)
code.csharp: public static float EaseOutQuad(float t) => t * (2f - t);
code.python:
def ease_out_quad(t: float) -> float:
    return t * (2 - t)

easeInOutQuad.name: Ease In-Out Quadratic
easeInOutQuad.description: Accelerates gently at start, decelerates gently at end with smooth transition
use_cases: UI panel sliding in and settling

code.javascript: function easeInOutQuad(t) { return t < 0.5 ? 2 * t * t : -1 + (4 - 2 * t) * t; }
code.lua:
function easeInOutQuad(t)
  if t < 0.5 then
    return 2 * t * t
  else
    return -1 + (4 - 2 * t) * t
  end
end
code.csharp: public static float EaseInOutQuad(float t) => t < 0.5f ? 2f * t * t : -1f + (4f - 2f * t) * t;
code.python:
def ease_in_out_quad(t: float) -> float:
    return 2 * t * t if t < 0.5 else -1 + (4 - 2 * t) * t

easeInCubic.name: Ease In Cubic
easeInCubic.description: Starts very slow and accelerates more aggressively than quadratic

code.javascript: function easeInCubic(t) { return t * t * t; }
code.lua: function easeInCubic(t) return t * t * t end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_cubic(t: float) -> float:
	return t * t * t
code.csharp: public static float EaseInCubic(float t) => t * t * t;
code.python:
def ease_in_cubic(t: float) -> float:
    return t * t * t

easeOutCubic.name: Ease Out Cubic
easeOutCubic.description: Starts fast and decelerates aggressively to a sudden stop

code.javascript: function easeOutCubic(t) { return (--t) * t * t + 1; }
code.lua:
function easeOutCubic(t)
  t = t - 1
  return t * t * t + 1
end
code.csharp: public static float EaseOutCubic(float t) { t -= 1f; return t * t * t + 1f; }

easeInOutCubic.name: Ease In-Out Cubic
easeInOutCubic.description: Smooth cubic acceleration and deceleration with pronounced ease

code.javascript: function easeInOutCubic(t) { return t < 0.5 ? 4 * t * t * t : (t - 1) * (2 * t - 2) * (2 * t - 2) + 1; }
code.lua:
function easeInOutCubic(t)
  if t < 0.5 then
    return 4 * t * t * t
  else
    return (t - 1) * (2 * t - 2) * (2 * t - 2) + 1
  end
end
code.csharp: public static float EaseInOutCubic(float t) => t < 0.5f ? 4f * t * t * t : (t - 1f) * (2f * t - 2f) * (2f * t - 2f) + 1f;
code.python:
def ease_in_out_cubic(t: float) -> float:
    return 4 * t * t * t if t < 0.5 else (t - 1) * (2 * t - 2) * (2 * t - 2) + 1

easeInQuart.name: Ease In Quartic
easeInQuart.description: Starts extremely slow with very aggressive acceleration curve

code.javascript: function easeInQuart(t) { return t * t * t * t; }
code.lua: function easeInQuart(t) return t * t * t * t end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_quart(t: float) -> float:
	return t * t * t * t
code.csharp: public static float EaseInQuart(float t) => t * t * t * t;
code.python:
def ease_in_quart(t: float) -> float:
    return t * t * t * t

easeOutQuart.name: Ease Out Quartic
easeOutQuart.description: Starts extremely fast and decelerates very aggressively

code.javascript: function easeOutQuart(t) { return 1 - (--t) * t * t * t; }
code.lua:
function easeOutQuart(t)
  t = t - 1
  return 1 - t * t * t * t
end
code.csharp: public static float EaseOutQuart(float t) { t -= 1f; return 1f - t * t * t * t; }

easeInOutQuart.name: Ease In-Out Quartic
easeInOutQuart.description: Very smooth quartic acceleration and deceleration for dramatic effects

code.javascript: function easeInOutQuart(t) { return t < 0.5 ? 8 * t * t * t * t : 1 - 8 * (--t) * t * t * t; }
code.lua:
function easeInOutQuart(t)
  if t < 0.5 then
    return 8 * t * t * t * t
  else
    t = t - 1
    return 1 - 8 * t * t * t * t
  end
end
code.csharp: public static float EaseInOutQuart(float t) { if (t < 0.5f) return 8f * t * t * t * t; t -= 1f; return 1f - 8f * t * t * t * t; }

easeInQuint.name: Ease In Quintic
easeInQuint.description: Extremely slow start with the most aggressive polynomial acceleration

code.javascript: function easeInQuint(t) { return t * t * t * t * t; }
code.lua: function easeInQuint(t) return t * t * t * t * t end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_quint(t: float) -> float:
	return t * t * t * t * t
code.csharp: public static float EaseInQuint(float t) => t * t * t * t * t;
code.python:
def ease_in_quint(t: float) -> float:
    return t * t * t * t * t

easeOutQuint.name: Ease Out Quintic
easeOutQuint.description: Extremely fast start with the most aggressive polynomial deceleration

code.javascript: function easeOutQuint(t) { return 1 + (--t) * t * t * t * t; }
code.lua:
function easeOutQuint(t)
  t = t - 1
  return 1 + t * t * t * t * t
end
code.csharp: public static float EaseOutQuint(float t) { t -= 1f; return 1f + t * t * t * t * t; }

easeInOutQuint.name: Ease In-Out Quintic
easeInOutQuint.description: Maximum smoothness with quintic acceleration and deceleration

code.javascript: function easeInOutQuint(t) { return t < 0.5 ? 16 * t * t * t * t * t : 1 + 16 * (--t) * t * t * t * t; }
code.lua:
function easeInOutQuint(t)
  if t < 0.5 then
    return 16 * t * t * t * t * t
  else
    t = t - 1
    return 1 + 16 * t * t * t * t * t
  end
end
code.csharp: public static float EaseInOutQuint(float t) { if (t < 0.5f) return 16f * t * t * t * t * t; t -= 1f; return 1f + 16f * t * t * t * t * t; }

easeInSine.name: Ease In Sine
easeInSine.description: Smooth sinusoidal acceleration with natural curved motion

code.javascript: function easeInSine(t) { return 1 - Math.cos(t * Math.PI / 2); }
code.lua: function easeInSine(t) return 1 - math.cos(t * math.pi / 2) end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_sine(t: float) -> float:
	return 1.0 - cos(t * PI / 2.0)
code.csharp: public static float EaseInSine(float t) => 1f - Mathf.Cos(t * Mathf.PI / 2f);

easeOutSine.name: Ease Out Sine
easeOutSine.description: Smooth sinusoidal deceleration with natural curved motion

code.javascript: function easeOutSine(t) { return Math.sin(t * Math.PI / 2); }
code.lua: function easeOutSine(t) return math.sin(t * math.pi / 2) end
code.gdscript:
func ease_out_sine(t: float) -> float:
	return sin(t * PI / 2.0)
code.csharp: public static float EaseOutSine(float t) => Mathf.Sin(t * Mathf.PI / 2f);

easeInOutSine.name: Ease In-Out Sine
easeInOutSine.description: Perfectly smooth sinusoidal motion for most natural feeling animations

code.javascript: function easeInOutSine(t) { return -(Math.cos(Math.PI * t) - 1) / 2; }
code.lua: function easeInOutSine(t) return -(math.cos(math.pi * t) - 1) / 2 end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_out_sine(t: float) -> float:
	return -(cos(PI * t) - 1.0) / 2.0
code.csharp: public static float EaseInOutSine(float t) => -(Mathf.Cos(Mathf.PI * t) - 1f) / 2f;

easeInExpo.name: Ease In Exponential
easeInExpo.description: Extremely slow start with explosive exponential acceleration at the end

code.javascript: function easeInExpo(t) { return t === 0 ? 0 : Math.pow(2, 10 * (t - 1)); }
code.csharp: public static float EaseInExpo(float t) => t == 0f ? 0f : Mathf.Pow(2f, 10f * (t - 1f));
code.python:
def ease_in_expo(t: float) -> float:
    return 0 if t == 0 else pow(2, 10 * (t - 1))

easeOutExpo.name: Ease Out Exponential
easeOutExpo.description: Explosive start with exponential deceleration settling quickly

code.javascript: function easeOutExpo(t) { return t === 1 ? 1 : 1 - Math.pow(2, -10 * t); }
code.csharp: public static float EaseOutExpo(float t) => t == 1f ? 1f : 1f - Mathf.Pow(2f, -10f * t);
code.python:
def ease_out_expo(t: float) -> float:
    return 1 if t == 1 else 1 - pow(2, -10 * t)

easeInOutExpo.name: Ease In-Out Exponential
easeInOutExpo.description: Explosive acceleration and deceleration with exponential curves

code.lua:
function easeInOutExpo(t)
  if t == 0 then return 0 end
  if t == 1 then return 1 end
  if t < 0.5 then
    return math.pow(2, 20 * t - 10) / 2
  else
    return (2 - math.pow(2, -20 * t + 10)) / 2
  end
end

easeInCirc.name: Ease In Circular
easeInCirc.description: Slow start following a circular arc with smooth acceleration
use_cases: Object rolling down a circular path

code.javascript: function easeInCirc(t) { return 1 - Math.sqrt(1 - t * t); }
code.lua: function easeInCirc(t) return 1 - math.sqrt(1 - t * t) end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_circ(t: float) -> float:
	return 1.0 - sqrt(1.0 - t * t)
code.csharp: public static float EaseInCirc(float t) => 1f - Mathf.Sqrt(1f - t * t);

easeOutCirc.name: Ease Out Circular
easeOutCirc.description: Fast start following a circular arc with smooth deceleration
use_cases: Object rolling up a circular path

code.javascript: function easeOutCirc(t) { return Math.sqrt(1 - (t - 1) * (t - 1)); }
code.lua: function easeOutCirc(t) return math.sqrt(1 - (t - 1) * (t - 1)) end
code.gdscript:
func ease_out_circ(t: float) -> float:
	return sqrt(1.0 - (t - 1.0) * (t - 1.0))
code.csharp: public static float EaseOutCirc(float t) => Mathf.Sqrt(1f - (t - 1f) * (t - 1f));

easeInOutCirc.name: Ease In-Out Circular
easeInOutCirc.description: Smooth circular motion with natural acceleration and deceleration

code.lua:
function easeInOutCirc(t)
  if t < 0.5 then
    return (1 - math.sqrt(1 - 4 * t * t)) / 2
  else
    return (math.sqrt(1 - 4 * (t - 1) * (t - 1)) + 1) / 2
  end
end

easeInBack.name: Ease In Back
easeInBack.description: Pulls back slightly before accelerating forward creating anticipation

code.lua:
function easeInBack(t)
  local c = 1.70158
  return (c + 1) * t * t * t - c * t * t
end

easeOutBack.name: Ease Out Back
easeOutBack.description: Overshoots target then settles back creating bounce-like effect

easeInOutBack.name: Ease In-Out Back
easeInOutBack.description: Pulls back at start and overshoots at end for dramatic motion
use_cases: Emphasis animation with wind-up and overshoot

code.lua:
function easeInOutBack(t)
  local c1 = 1.70158
  local c2 = c1 * 1.525
  if t < 0.5 then
    return (math.pow(2 * t, 2) * ((c2 + 1) * 2 * t - c2)) / 2
  else
    return (math.pow(2 * t - 2, 2) * ((c2 + 1) * (2 * t - 2) + c2) + 2) / 2
  end
end

easeOutBounce.name: Ease Out Bounce
easeOutBounce.description: Bounces multiple times at the end with decreasing amplitude

code.lua:
function easeOutBounce(t)
  local n1 = 7.5625
  local d1 = 2.75
  if t < 1 / d1 then
    return n1 * t * t
  elseif t < 2 / d1 then
    t = t - 1.5 / d1
    return n1 * t * t + 0.75
  elseif t < 2.5 / d1 then
    t = t - 2.25 / d1
    return n1 * t * t + 0.9375
  else
    t = t - 2.625 / d1
    return n1 * t * t + 0.984375
  end
end

easeInBounce.name: Ease In Bounce
easeInBounce.description: Bounces multiple times at the start with increasing amplitude

code.javascript: function easeInBounce(t) { return 1 - easeOutBounce(1 - t); }
code.lua: function easeInBounce(t) return 1 - easeOutBounce(1 - t) end
code.gdscript:
func ease_in_bounce(t: float) -> float:
	return 1.0 - ease_out_bounce(1.0 - t)
code.csharp: public static float EaseInBounce(float t) => 1f - EaseOutBounce(1f - t);
code.python:
def ease_in_bounce(t: float) -> float:
    return 1 - ease_out_bounce(1 - t)

easeInOutBounce.name: Ease In-Out Bounce
easeInOutBounce.description: Bounces at both start and end for playful symmetric motion

code.lua:
function easeInOutBounce(t)
  if t < 0.5 then
    return (1 - easeOutBounce(1 - 2 * t)) / 2
  else
    return (1 + easeOutBounce(2 * t - 1)) / 2
  end
end

easeInElastic.name: Ease In Elastic
easeInElastic.description: Oscillates with increasing amplitude like a spring being compressed

easeOutElastic.name: Ease Out Elastic
easeOutElastic.description: Oscillates with decreasing amplitude like a spring being released

code.lua:
function easeOutElastic(t)
  if t == 0 then return 0 end
  if t == 1 then return 1 end
  return math.pow(2, -10 * t) * math.sin((t * 10 - 0.75) * (2 * math.pi) / 3) + 1
end

easeInOutElastic.name: Ease In-Out Elastic
easeInOutElastic.description: Spring-like oscillation at both start and end with symmetric motion

code.lua:
function easeInOutElastic(t)
  if t == 0 then return 0 end
  if t == 1 then return 1 end
  local c5 = (2 * math.pi) / 4.5
  if t < 0.5 then
    return -(math.pow(2, 20 * t - 10) * math.sin((20 * t - 11.125) * c5)) / 2
  else
    return (math.pow(2, -20 * t + 10) * math.sin((20 * t - 11.125) * c5)) / 2 + 1
  end
end
